Due to alcohol's vasodilation, THC and other active inhaled cannibinoids will 1) absorb faster in the lungs (this doesn't change a huge amount since THC is absorbed very quickly in the lungs) and 2) will pass the blood-brain barrier much more quickly and effectively. I’ve been getting drunk and stoned (at the same time) for the past 5 years and it has honestly wrecked my life.

It started as I was finishing university, I knew a friend who dealt and it was amazing, I was often a hyperactive person (maybe I’m undiagnosed with something like ADHD) and both my parents died when I was a young kid. after going through an abusive foster care home there were many mental issues I was having and traumas from both the loss of my parents and the injustice at the foster home, I found that smoking weed for the first time transported me to a land of carefreeness. I gradually got more into it, I had family with substance abuse problems so it was a bad idea for me to tempt fate. I began drinking at the same time as drinking was apart of the college culture and ended up complimenting the weed perfectly. Once I graduated properly I got an almost 6 digit sum of money left over from my dads pension and my grandparents saving for me, I ruined everything with it, I spent thousands that first few weeks alone on weed, Alcohol and sometimes hookers.

I spiralled for over a year and it got worse, I rarely left my room, I was living the high life off this money and I was losing it faster and faster. A year turned into 2, I stopped communicating with people back home, I’d ended staying out where I studied. The only family I have left is my uncle and aunt who I respect more than anything, but they saw my dad go down a similar path so I kept it from them to spare them the pain of history repeating itself. I’d torrent all the shows and films I could ever want, bought the best consoles and video games and I have turned myself into a anxious wreck. I tell myself I was anxious before this habit and claims that the smoking and drinking relieves it, I can’t tell anymore.
2 years turned to 3, I think my uncle has clocked on what might be happening. Still, every night, I drink the same amount of alcohol I would’ve normally done on New Year’s Day, except every day. I’d stick to a system of 2 cigarettes then a joint, I’d do that up to 10 times a night whilst drinking.

3 years became 5, I know I’ve missed out 4 but that’s because 4 may well have not existed, it’s become a haze, I’ve been on this sort of autopilot now for at least 2 years maybe 3 or more even.
The money began to properly run out around this time last year. Iv tried getting jobs (throughout the 5 years) but this habit destroyed every one of them, the amount of places I lasted a single day it would be ridiculous.

I started receiving welfare about 8 months ago, it’s not enough to cover my addiction obviously, I can clean to my uncle and he was just as sorrowful as I expected. I sit here now on March 13th 2021, I’m about to go into my overdraft and I’m scared because I can’t stop. Crazy thing is, this money I inherited came in 2 instalments, I remember when the first lot ran out and I got into debt I remember hating myself, all my money is gone I’ll never screw up this bad again, thing is, I didn’t know I was due to get any more money, it just happened that way, and I’ve done the same thing again, this time there’s no get out clause.

I have the last of my weed here rolled already now, which is enough to last me tonight, I plan on going out to get a gallon of 7.5% cider for tonight to drink along with smoking. Tomorrow I have a choice, in fact I have a choice now but I’ve already decided to what I’ve just said. I go into my overdraft if I pick up tomorrow, or I stop, but everytime I’ve tried before I have failed and I’m almost certain I will fail again, I say this because I needed to write something down about it. If anyone takes the time to read this, thank you, I’m not sure there’s a quick and easy fix to this but it’s felt good to write it down.

I feel like I should say this, though I know most of the people here with either not believe me, make fun of me, or think I’m an idiot.

At one point in my life, I was drinking and smoking weed everyday. All of a sudden one day, I started waking up not remembering who or where I was, or what had happened the past few days. Not too long after that, I woke up in a hospital bed, being told I was having seizures and they didn’t know why.

They put me on life long medication for a supposed epilepsy disorder, they said they concluded this from my EEG. I decided once this happened to give it all up forever.

A few months went by and I decided to go back for another EEG, and it was normal. Every symptom I had (confusion, psychosis, depression, anxiety,) all went away.

Things are fine in moderation, but don’t believe for a second sitting there smoking and drinking your worries away will go without damages. You’ll destroy yourself.

I hope someone listens, but when I look back on how I used to think, I don’t know if I would listen either, until it’s too late.

I had a horrible experience about one year ago. I was at a party, I’ve just bought myself a bottle of vodka and was ready to let loose. I drank the whole bottle over the night and got really drunk. Somehow I found out that someone had weed on them so me and a few people went out and started smoking. When I got back in I felt very chill and relaxed, then suddenly I saw in tunnel vision. I tried to ignore it but it gave me the creeps. Somehow I managed to get into the bathroom and I fell over the toilet. I was throwing my guts out. When I was done I fell asleep on the floor, I don’t know for how long but remember waking up and hyperventilating. I didn’t know what was going on but looking back at it I know that I had a panic attack. I thought I was going to die. I chipped for air but there was no air to breath. Drunk and high I unlocked the bathroom door and ran into the kitchen. I sat down with some drunk friends at the dining table and I was freaking out. Both my arms and legs went numb and I thought I was dying, it was horrible. I started screaming for ambulance and someone to rescue me but people just stood there in shock. Today I don’t blame them, they didn’t know what to do. It was this one girl who helped me tho, she gave me a glass of water and helped me get outside to get fresh air. I threw up once again, I think I’ve never puked that much in my entire life. Somehow I got into a car and managed to get into my friend’s apartment. The rest I don’t remember. Since that day I haven’t mixed nor smoked weed. I tried weed once more after that but I just started to hyperventilating again so I stopped smoking.

Last night I didn’t get a chance to eat anything all day other than breakfast. During the evening I was offered a glass of wine which then turned into multiple glasses. I then was offered weed out of the bong. I was decently tipsy however after that bong rip my mind totally blanked out and I lost all ability to stand or even focus on one thing. I got my cousin to drive me home but once I arrived to my house I couldn’t move, I was paralyzed.. felt like I was covered in cement. I could barely breathe and I was hallucinating whenever I closed my eyes. She continued to drive so I could relax more that’s when I proceeded to vomit everywhere but I didn’t have the effort to move. I was dragged out of the car while vomiting. I was convinced that I was drugged until I read online the dangers of smoking when you’re already drunk. She managed to carry me to my house where I passed out on my couch with my coat and boots on. It was the most horrifying experience and I will NEVER put myself through that again. I can’t even explain how scary it was, not being able to talk or move but you’re able to hear everything around you. Be careful when mixing drugs because it can really happen to anyone.

Hello, In 2007 I started studying in China and in 2012 I had to finish university. In March 2012, one evening I went to have a beer with friends. That evening I drank somewhere 3 to 4 bottles of beer. Those friends had offered me some drugs which used a ‘bong’ where you inhale smoke. At this point, I was drunk and did not know how strong this drug was (I later found out that it was grass mixed with a large dose of bongo) and I tried it for the first time in my life I breathed out once. After one or two minutes as I triedI immediately started feeling bad and started panicking, time became very slow. The next day I was glad that I felt alright. And that evening a friend had a birthday and I had few beers with friends almost 6 to 7 bottles of beer and when i went home I felt like puking but did instead straight went to bed to sleep. The next day when I woke up my health became very bad, all the body felt heavy began to hurt in the right side of back of my head very strongly at one point as if knocking an axe in the head, when i walked it became very difficult as my coordination of movement was not right as I stood I felt like leaning towards my left side a bit. I had these symptoms for quite some time that I had to return back home to do some medical treatment as I did such as plasmapheresis, many IV drops against poisoning. I felt a bit better by the treatment of almost more than a month of duration. Still I had symptoms few symptoms that was bothering me like my body felt so heavy and there was a pain or something felt not right at the back of my head in the right side. I went to the mandatory military training for a year, after few months in the military my health became much more better and those symptoms went away. A year later, health improved began to work, involved in sports participated in various competitions lived normally. After 2 years of poisoning in 2015, after work, I went to drink few beers with friends and drank somewhere between 5-6 bottles and the next day my health became very bad again. The whole body became very heavy. It kept pushing down as if carrying a very heavy thing. Everything presses down on earth as if the gravity of the earth had increased. Feeling of a heavy body where the center of gravity is there and the pressure force when I stand all presses down on the foot and foot, when you sit on your back and back. Became difficult to swallow, since then this feeling of pressure of the body as if the body has become very heavy did not disappear disappeared, but despite this I lived normally and after that I never drank alcohol. After 3 years in 2018 in March, one day I saw my friend and he had a cannabis weed and offered me saying that it was actually used for some medical treatments and had little harm to someone. I took only one small puff and after few minutes when my body felt not right I started panicking. My body was not right and started feeling heavier. The next day I still had those feeling and I started becoming more distressed thinking that It may require quite some time to recover and in order to get better quickly I went to a hospital and they had given me treatments for cerebral circulation and nerve system, I was not feeling any better with the treatment and one day they had given me IV drop‘kaventon’and during the IV treatment my body started feeling very bad that I had to tell the nurse to stop the treatment. After that my body felt worse. I left the hospital and after one or two days I had a diarrhea and after few stools in a few hours my body felt very weak and felt very heavy that I started panicking for help. The place where the head ached, it ached more, heaviness of the body was increased, even walking became difficult, it took a lot of effort to walk and something pulled to the left when i walked. All the time there was dryness in the mouth, difficult to swallow, weakness of the muscles of the legs, when i walked my body felt so heavy and with the uneven coordination to the left, my head span. So once again I did plasmapheresis in hope of getting rid of these bad symptoms but unfortunately my body felt worse and I had to take a IV drop treatment of ‘Ringer’ for few times and actually it felt better but the symptoms are still intact.
I saw some specialists and did quite many tests related to the brain structure and blood circulation. The outcome of almost all the tests that I had given they were quite alright and no serious illness was discovered materialistically. I did a MRI test in my brain structure and it was all normal. I also did the Romberg test, stood with two of my foot straight and togethered together with closed eyes and stretched my hands. I felt like falling just in 1 or 2 seconds after closing my eye. My head started spinning immediately. And to this day, these symptoms have remained still, and in my country I cannot find any solutions to my body. Few specialists said it was vestibular syndrome or toxic neuropathy or toxic encephalopathy. I ask for your help sincerely and I hope you would give me a reply anyways even if you could not please refer me to somewhere please. If you can help me, please let me know about the cost and duration of time. This is my whole truth and I am in need of medical help. Thank you.

Medical marijuana patient watching. I don’t drink very much or ever. I’ll say that besides the typical buzzed feel seems to be the same for me. I only see a slight effect like that with my opioid pain meds. I’ll say as a person obviously in favor of medical marijuana, after going to the pharmacy for years now, I see as many people older than me as I do younger ones. It’s more obvious with the younger people in their appearance and actions. I’ve sat with little old ladies that haven’t ever used it that are now. They have found medication that works without side effects, helps them sleep better, and makes their traditional medication’s side effects like nausea tolerable enough to eat and have a life.

It’s so sad to see so many people being helped, when so many people have an opinion about something they’ve never been around to see for themselves. So many people in different states aren’t able to get access. So many people are suffering needlessly because of the state they live in. So many people are afflicted in so many ways, and they will never give it a chance because of stigma and false information.

My mother has smoked 1 time in her life in the 60’s and someone laced it with something. She’s never gone near it since. After my medical problems and my license, she’s gotten a different sense about it. Since my problems incapacitate me, my prescriber has made her a caregiver so that she can get it for me. She was so intimidated. She handed her id over and said it would be a few minutes. She sat and talked with many people her age, and older. They have all had the same feeling, so she felt more comfortable not being alone in her nervousness. She quickly wasn’t nervous when someone explained what you do and what happens beyond the waiting room. She was called and went in, she was instantly comforted by the staff. They’re very nice, warm, and professional and wouldn’t ever rush her. They helped her find what to get, she was going to call, but they remember me and what I get. She was flabbergasted, every time she felt the nerves creeping in, they alleviated instantly with whatever she needed. She left 180° from walking in 10 minutes ago. She’s never felt anything like that ever again. She now has gone to my prescriber to get her own license, and got a thc and a cbd pen. She’s so much better in many ways. She’s glad she gave it a try.

If you know of someone in need of help from medical problems, please suggest they try. We’ve finally passed the 50% mark for public approval, they will all fall like dominos from here on out. We need this with the heroin epidemic. A friend of mine has gotten over his opiate dependence with marijuana. It gave him enough of a damper to deal with cravings. He doesn’t smoke it anymore, but will if he needs to. It’s a miracle drug for me and a few others.

I'm a stoner but I don't really drink that much during the day. I'll drink maybe 1 whole Mike's Harder Lemonade before I smoke in the mornings but the funny thing is you actually don't even feel the alcohol at all if you smoke everyday.  All alcohol does for me in small, normal, or medium amounts is "recycle" my weed high. It works best with 5-8% alcohol levels but honestly any amount of alcohol (*FOLLOWED* by small bowl of bong hits) will usually get the job done. It's important that you smoke AFTER you drink for the strongest effect, but there have been times when I was out of cannabis and drank a beer instead. I actually felt a little stoned after drinking it and got the munchies. A small bit of alcohol + any cannabis = 1000x stronger than any dab I have even smoked. I think the alcohol helps promote better metabolism of THC and CBD. If you Google what I'm talking about there is actually studies out there which have concluded that those who drank a beer before smoking had an increased level of THC concentration in the blood than they would have if they only smoked. Maybe the alcohol breaks the cannabinoids down making them easier to metabolize. Another interesting interaction is if you pour hard liquor or rubbing alcohol on cannabis it will liquefy the resin. I haven't tried unleaded gas yet though..

I actually have some experience here, i was a heavy drinker in college, never yacked once even one night after a whole 70cl (standard sized) bottle of vodka ove 4-6 hours. Just to myself. Just one example of numerous binges I had in just freshers alone. However after dropping the bottle and switching back to pot during a whole summer of daily smoking with no alcohol I got the wise idea to mix the two and after only a bottle of wine (and a good meal beforehand) with two joints (mixed with tobacco) i spewed pure liquid into my bathroom sink. Felt a whole lot better after but I'm sure I'd have never felt bad in the first place if i'd stuck to one poison that night. More research needs to be done on the compatibility of these drugs as they become legalised and videos like this help spread awareness.
I will say I tend to game a lot when intoxicated and I feel like games are a good way to probe different behaviourism and functional ability when in altered mental states. I found green made me more aware of my surroundings, want to play support roles and encourage communication and synergy with teammates on overwatch. on rocket league I'd think differently at how to approach difficult manoeuver, I often found myself learning new things but it was easy to let my guard down and pass it to my inebriated muscle memory and I'd soon be shocked at how I missed simple opportunities. Alcohol on the other hand got me fired up, I was more proactive and confident in my playstyle, to me whatever I did looked either genius or embarrassingly sloppy depending on how much I'd drank.
Mixing the two is a gamble. I can peak at a balance if I'd had good sleep, moderated intake of both and ate well. That allows me to find some sort of euphoric balance and have good vibes and jam to music. Otherwise I get super sleepy and crash out after a game, and there was that one time i mentioned before that I puked. Thats from a guy that hadn't puked for 10 years before that.

If you're gonna do this... Consider the following...

Yes. Alcohol makes the cannabis high better. God damn. Alcohol and weed can provide such a euphoric high. It's rather great.

But... err... Similar to what others are saying here, the combination does NOT prevent vomiting. I've had numerous experiences...

If you overdo the alcohol, there's a very high chance you'll vomit. Trust me. The combination can become very unpleasant.

My friend and I consumed a bottle and a half of wine EACH - we were both feeling very drunk. But a euphoric and happy drunk.

We then decided to smoke a king spliff each. Following this night ruining decision, we both proceeded to vomit our guts out within an hour.

Maybe you'll get lucky... Just don't over do the alcohol and you'll be fine. It is a poison after all. Weed on the other hand killed no one.

This video lacks a lot of pivotal information - such as how the order in which you take the two severely effects your experience - and the vomiting thing is a load of shit depending on said order. If you drink first, to the point of feeling the alcohol's effects, and then smoke weed, your chances of throwing up are nearly 100%, for the average user. I've seen literally hundreds of people try to prove this wrong, and only a couple were successful. Smoke first, then drink, then smoke, then drink. It's the best way to go. OR don't drink and don't worry about vomiting at all - there are plenty of high enhancers out there that don't cause you to drive like a moron or give you the spins.

The only problem with weed is that it really is a gateway drug. Consider this: You decide to smoke weed for 6 months (i know i know just bare with me here). For the first two months you smoke once a week, kinda like a weekend thing. After the second month, you decide that maybe if I smoked some during the week after work or whatever it'll be fine, no worries right? So now you're smoking up to 3 times a week. Not horrible, still manageable but now you start feeling tired while working the next day. Oh well, maybe I just stayed up too late last night and didn't get enough sleep, whatever.

Starting month 4, you start noticing that, the same dosage you have been taking each time you smoke, which hasn't changed since day 1, doesn't get you that high anymore (this is possible to happen sooner for a lot a people, like I said bare with me). So now you decide maybe I double my dosage and see if that helps... my my does it help.

Month 5, these drowsy after affects start lasting longer and longer and your high starts reducing to less than normal. You again, starting thinking, maybe I have a really high tolerance now and need to start taking higher dosages. Well, that's fine and dandy, I have the money I might as well just do it anyway.

Come month 6 you are likely to be smoking every day, your high might be lasting maybe an hour, and some paranoia like affects can start arising through high dosages ( not always but quite possibly). By now, its even likely you've heard of and even consumed dabs of THC (high concentrate). This, not only gets you extremely high, but raises your tolerance levels even further, to the point where that double dosage of weed you were smoking doesnt really have an affect on you, it probably gives you a head rush for maybe an hour and you are left drowsy and lazy for the next day.

My point of all of this is, if you cannot control your dosage and how you consume it to a very moderate minimum, you are likely to want to move on to much harder drugs and chemicals that will actually damage your brain and cause severe memory loss and anxiety/paranoia.

Just be careful people, drugs are not to mess around with, even if its "just weed bro".

Actually my own (and pretty much every other person's that i talked to about this) practice shows that effects of connecting THC with alcohol are drasticly different depending on the order of taking it.

If you smoke first (no matter how much) and then drink alcohol you are probably totaly fine, and still more stoned than drunk for the most of the night (and this is the prefferable way i can totally recommend).
But if you get really hammered first, and then you take even a very small hit (or just 2 instead of 1 which would be already enough, and as we all know after alcohol good judgement is pretty much impossible, especially considering that THC takes a few minutes to trully hit you with it's full power) can cause instant and very serious nausea, vomitting (even thc is considered anti vomiting, the rollercoster in you head is just to much to handle sometimes), memmory gaps and almost always after some time a blackout resulting in penises and swastikas all over you face.
It's a bit simmilar like the rule that you can mix alcohols going up with %, but not down just assuming that weed is like a wine.
@AsapSCIENCE : It's very consistant with the fact that alco is widening blood vessels but i really think you should include that very practical knowledge for the sake of viewers which may try mixing this drugs together for the first time thanks to your video.
Also you should mention that pretty much the best possible way for a very nasty hangover is taking a not to big hit of thc in the morning, or just before going to sleep (if you're not still hammered af obviously), preferably with a large spoon of honey or other fruit rich in fructose which really helps metabolism fight the alcohol and toxins.

tl;dr :
If you're drunk take one hit at a time waiting a another round for shit to hit you.
If you have a choice then smoke first, drink second.
